column4: /dev/hdc        /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 ro,user,noauto  0       0
Instead of using /mnt, /media is used for removable devices. Debian does it this way as well.
I can mount cds but this one I cant!
What filesystem is on the CD?
I don't know, I suppose iso9660
same error :(
Ok try this. mount /dev/hdc /media/cdrom0
Do you have any Windows installation you could try it on?
yes, I have an XP installation
yeah with XP there's no problem
What filesystem does Windows say the CD has?
I don't know. But if Windows recognises it, there is something fishy going on.
Do you have the isofs module in your kernel, and is it loaded?
Type lsmod | grep isofs and see what you get.
isofs                  33976  0
So it is loaded. Hmmmm
One thing you could try and do if you had the disk space, is to rip the data off the CD onto your computer as an iso, and try mounting that.
I dont have the cd content, I've tried 3 times to eject-insert the cd
But you can rip the raw filesystem and the data off the CD without actually mounting it.
I know this doesn't help getting the data in the short-term, but perhaps mounting the ISO as a loop device may bring more luck.
ok, so: mount ...?
Then you type dd if=/dev/hdc of=/path/to/where/you/want/the/file.iso
I have to go now, thanks anyway
Sorry I couldn't help you.
